CatDescriptText: Mrs. Geraldine Coleman, clerk-typist, Fifth Ward, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think religion will play a major part in the choosing of the presidential candidate?  If so, why?" Mrs. Geraldine Coleman's answer reads: "I believe that the selection of a person for office should be based on ability, on his qualifications, rather than religious beliefs.  i believe that extenuating circumstances, such as the international situation and others, may overshadow religion in this coming election."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of man wearing dark gabardine suit jacket and moustache, standing in front of traffic light, building, and Thrift Drugs and Kappels signs, Fifth Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Geraldine Coleman wearing shirt dress and sunglasses, standing in front of taxi and building with steak house sign
